QuestionStatement: A country’s government runs a budget deficit when which of the following occurs in a given year?
AnswerChoices: The amount of new loans to developing nations exceeds the amount of loans paid off by developing nations.
The debt owed to foreigners exceeds the debt owed to the country’s citizens
The amount of borrowed exceeds the interest payment on the national debt
Interest payments on the national debt exceed spending on goods and services

QuestionStatement: A high marginal propensity to consume implies which of the following?
AnswerChoices: A small change in consumption when income changes
An equilibrium level of income near full employment
A low marginal propensity to save

QuestionStatement: The transaction demand for money is very closely associated with money’s use as a
Unlike a market economy, a command economy uses
AnswerChoices: More centralized planning in economic decision making
Consumer sovereignty to make production decisions
Price signals in economic decision making
The popular vote in making resource allocations

QuestionStatement: The value of a country’s currency will tend to appreciate if
AnswerChoices: Demand for the country’s exports increases
The country’s citizens increase their travel abroad
Tariffs on the country’s imports decrease

QuestionStatement: Which of the following best illustrates an improvement in a country’s standard of living?
AnswerChoices: An increase in real per capita gross domestic product
An increase in nominal per capita gross domestic product
An increase in the consumer price index

QuestionStatement: Hyperinflation is typically caused by
AnswerChoices: High tax rates that discourage work effort
Continuous expansion of the money supply to finance government budget deficits
Trade surpluses that are caused by strong protectionist policies
Bad harvests that lead to widespread shortages
A large decline in corporate profits that leads to a decrease in production

QuestionStatement: All of the following will shift the investment demand curve to the right EXCEPT
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the corporate income tax rate
An increase in the productivity of new capital goods
An increase in the real interest rate
An increase in real gross domestic product

QuestionStatement: The official unemployment rate understates the unemployment level in the economy because the official unemployment rate
AnswerChoices: Includes jobs created by the underground economy

QuestionStatement: If a reduction in aggregate supply is followed by an increase in aggregate demand, which of the following will definitely occur?
Which of the following combinations of changes in government spending and taxes is necessarily expansionary?
The amount of money that the public wants to hold in the form of cash will
AnswerChoices: Be unaffected by any change in interest rates or the price level
Increase if the price level decreases
Decrease if the price level remains constant

QuestionStatement: For an economy consisting of households and businesses only, which of the following is consistent with the circular flow of income and production?
AnswerChoices: Households are producers of goods and services and consumers of resources
Households are users of resources, and businesses are sources of saving
Households are suppliers of resources and consumers of goods and services
Businesses are users of taxes, and households are sources of taxes
Businesses are suppliers or resources and consumers of goods and services

QuestionStatement: With an increase in the real interest rate, consumption and real gross domestic product will most likely change in which of the following ways?
According to the short-run Phillips curve, lower inflation rates are associated with
Which of the following will lead to a decrease in a nation’s money supply?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in income tax rates
A decrease in the discount rate
An open market purchase of government securities by the central bank
An increase in government expenditures on goods and services

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following would cause the aggregate demand curve to shift to the left?
Which of the following changes in the supply of and the demand for a good will definitely result in a decrease in both the equilibrium price and quantity of the good?
Based on the balance sheets for three different banks, which of the following is true, if the reserve requirement is 10 percent?
AnswerChoices: Bank A has no excess reserves
Bank B has no excess reserves
Bank B can increase its loans by $500
Bank B can increase its loans by $40

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will most likely lead to a decrease in inflationary expectations?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the marginal propensity to save
A decrease in the money supply
An increase in the government budget deficit
An increase in the prices of raw materials
